reviews.review:
Pas possible de configurer les settings... S√©rieux?!
Pourtant l'id√©e avait l'air chouette!

Awesome game
10 trappers/10

*****Updated Review through time****

First of all I would like to say that this game is an amazing game for being in beta still! Honestly that's what it is. Rushed out before it was finished like most games nowadays. 

This game is tons of fun; the concept is fantastic and addictive. However the mechanics and processes that come along with the concept are either broken or lacking. 

The join lobby is not a queue rather a quick join. With that you get a lot of "failed to connect" issues. 

There is no party system so you cannot play with your friends on a ranked system. You are left with a create a friends only lobby that nets you nothing. A party system was promised on release since it was not in beta as well; harking back to why this is still beta.

The some perks are broken, vague, or worded wrong. For example the "Insidious" perk says "unlocks the stealth ability. By standing still for 3 seconds you reduce your terror radius to zero and become stealthy until you act again." You would think that you would become invisible because the game teaches you that as stealth from the wraith but you do not. it just reduces your terror range to zero despite it leading you to think there are two properties. The survivor perk "spine Chill" is completely broken and does nothing. 

A lot of the skill tree is vague as well. When i fist started playing and getting items some would say "increases your blood points for Boldness." What is Boldness??? I had no idea b the game never explains it nor is there a way to look at it in the menus. It just shows quickly at the end of the game.

Add on's: there are add on's for you to add onto the items you bring. Some are also broken others don't do what the explanation says. 

There is no punishment for stalling, leaving games, or dodging a pregame if you think the players are to hard to play against. You can literally wait an troll for Hours in game. For example I got glitched into the floor while opening a chest, no reason why it just happened. I couldn't move, no one could save me and the killer couldn't hit me. So it became a waiting game of "who will leave first?" You can do the same thing at the exit, leaving the killer to wander and hope someone massively slips up. If no one does then its whenever they want to end the game. 

 Further more people can disconnect from the game without punishment and further punishing players who want to play. Another personal example is that I was running for the exit and just about to get there and the killer pressed Alt F4, causing the game to end. The game brings you to the victory screen and says "you escaped" but you don't get any additional points. You Have to escape using the games mechanics to get those points; the killer robbed us of that and didn't get any lesser points then what he was going to get nor a punishment of any kind. On top of that, If they do that to you your survivor rank goes down! it's not based on wins its based on points accumulated withing the game. If you are a killer and get into a game where everyone DC's right off the bat, you go to the great victory screen and then the, bummer you lose a rank screen. 

The menu UI is not fluid and clunky in places, not terrible but a super easy fix and should be perfect for release.

In short:

Even with these looming problems and then some; this game is addictive and fantastic. I am still going to play it but keeping in mind that the game is broken and people who break the rules get off scott free while punishing you. If you don't accept that then this game will be a frustrating mess for you. 

**Update!*

The new DLC came out and luckily the game no longer works! Seems like they are scrambling now, just in time for a random free weekend download!

******UPDATE!****

I main survivor and its hard to keep playing this game when the killers are so underpowered. There really needs to be a rebalance. I shouldnt be able to abuse and man handle a killer by myself.

******UPDATE AGAIN 4/10/19*****

Been Awhile since I have played but same problems it seems. Super Toxic community still. Did a daily quest as a killer and was told that I "tunnel, Proxy-camp, camp gens, camp hooks, spam my killer ability, and use unfair perks." How did i do all of those in one game. How do killers even manage in this anymore??? We need killers because they are the brunt of the game.


*********Update AAAGGAAAIIINNN 3/28/2020********

Here we are again with another update after several month hiatus. Truly this game has come a long way and I can finally say that I can recommended this game. I would say that there are very slight balancing issues for the higher tier player thus of which are indicative of these style of games that get new abilities and skill sets added regularly. The game overall looks and feels better mechanically and visually now.  Although the game does go on sale and randomly bundles DLC; I would honestly say its worth the 19.99 price for PC users, but you can make you dollar stretch more based on your patience. The game still has a "Toxic" side but its somewhat better now. You can just ignore the comments if need be but you will still get players who complain to a toxic level on you using certain combination "perks" or using a killer on how they are intended to be used.
This game is siiiiiiiiiiiiiiiick

A great game to play with friends, unbelievably funny. That being said the game's netcode is completely fucked and the matchmaking and gameplay is very unbalanced. DBDL also lacks a party system so playing online with your friends in a non-private match isn't possible as of right now. This game needs a lot of work before it's worth any sort of money, but the Devs seem dedicated and hopefully soon the game will be in playable shape.

Amazing game, really is a lot of fun. This game is actually the most fun I've had in a long time. 

I've started streaming and recording my gameplay again, which I haven't done in over 2 years. I've dedicated my entire stream and YouTube channel specifically for this game. I was feeling really bad about life, but this game makes me feel a lot better and streaming has really lifted my spirits.

Seriously guys, buy this game. The developers are going to fix [b]a lot[/b] of issues really soon. Every new game has bugs, buy the game now and play it. This game is worth your time and money.

10/10, and it's only going to get better.

Because as it stands the Dev team does not have the encouragement needed to acknowledge the true health of the game. Honestly, just go play Civ 5 this company doesn't need your money. yeah, nah

Dead By Daylight is overall a fun game. However, needs quite a lot of work and balancing to become a great game. No party system makes it hard for people with only 1-2 freinds. The ranking system is some what broken. In the sense that is very hard to rank up. Now the worst part is some of the exploits that the survivors can use to make it impossible for the killer to get them. From vaulting over 2 ledges that are right next to each other to running around a truck endlessly to avoid the killer. It can make the game infinitely more frustrating to play. In conlusion, Dead By Daylight needs work. It's a fun game but, it might've needed a little more time before it's release. Hopefully the devolpers can fix these issues within the game. 6/10. Worth a buy if you have a group of freinds to play with.

This game used to be my all-time favorite game, and as you can see I have over 1400 hours played. I loved the competitive nature of the game and I felt like it was always worth my time to continue improving. However, throughout the years DBD (Dead by Daylight) has become very casual. This is mostly because of a new progression system they added called the Archives. 

The Archives is essentially a battle pass, where you have 70 days to progress through different objectives whilst receiving awards, with more rewards if you decide to buy the premium version. As a result of this, a lot of killers and survivors (myself included) purposefully play sub-optimally in order to complete the objectives in their battle pass. Most of the objectives can be completed while playing optimally, however some of them (such as having to sabotage a certain amount of hooks as a survivor or having to hook a certain amount of survivors in the basement as killer) take away from the main objective of the game, forcing people to ruin the competitive nature it if they want to complete the Archives before the 70 day period is over. Since at least 1 out of the 5 players in your game is likely to be doing an Archive objective that takes away from the main objective, it is very unlikely that all of the players will be giving their utmost to win. There have always been casual players in DBD due to the fact that there are no rewards for reaching rank 1 (which, by the way, people have been asking for since the very beginning of the game), however the game was very seldom ruined by such players due to the fact that there weren't that many of them. However, with the Archives, it is very seldom that you'll find a game that isn't ruined.

Aside from the uncompetitive nature of the game, even when you do reach rank 1 (the highest rank obtainable as killer or survivor) it is very unbalanced in favor of the survivor, and pretty much has been since the existence of the game. The developers have even stated that they plan to balance the game toward lower ranks. Generators are able to be repaired way too quickly for the killer to be able to stop the repair of them until all the survivors are killed. For reference, repairing a generator with one survivor takes 80 seconds, with two survivors takes 47.06 seconds, with three survivors takes 38.1 seconds and with four survivors takes 36.36 seconds (all without items or perks that increase generator repair speed). First of all, while playing a killer that has no movement abilities, it is possible that a generator can be completed before a killer gets to it even if they start gunning for it as soon as they spawn into the match. Additionally, as soon as good survivors see you get into a chase with someone else, they're all going to get onto a generator, especially if all of the survivors are in survive with friends and are communicating with each other. Therefore, assuming that 3 different survivors are on 3 different generators and you're chasing someone for at least 80 seconds (which is fairly common at high ranks with at most times zero possible counter-play), 3 generators can be done before you can even hook one person. Since each person requires 3 hooks to kill assuming that they get saved before entering the next phase, it is almost impossible to kill everyone unless the survivors really mess up. There are perks such as Hex: Ruin and Corrupt Intervention that can slow down generator repair, but Hex: Ruin is gone as soon as its respective totem is gone and Corrupt Intervention only lasts 2 minutes and doesn't even affect every generator. Additionally, Hex: Ruin only makes a difference if survivors don't hit great skill checks every time, otherwise it is almost entirely worthless.

If you are looking for a casual game where you can just mess around, DBD is definitely the game for you. However, if you are looking for a competitive game where you can constantly be improving in order to best your competition, this game isn't, and never will be (due to the path that the developers are taking), the game for you.
I really love the game. It's amazing and fun to play with friends. I hope there are going to come some more awesome killers so that the game will become even better!

I am giving this game a positive review although it needs many fixes. This game is very exhilerating and fun with friends, it can be frustrating with randoms sometimes. It has the potential to be much better than it currently is.
I know that the game just got released and I am loving it. It just needs some fixes that's all. 

1. LOBBY.
- About 90% of the time when you try to join a lobby as a survivor it says "FAILED TO JOIN THE GAME. This is not major but very annoying!
- And as a killer you sometimes need to wait up to more than 10 minutes for people to join your lobby. It gets REALLY annoying

2. MATCHMAKING.
- I simply don't understand it. 99% of the time I join a lobby as a survivor I get teamed up with low ranks and somewhat low levels.
- However, 99% of the time I make my lobby as a killer the people who join are very high rank, often higher than 10. (I am rank 20 most of the time because I simply can't be arsed ranking up as of now)

3. BUGS.
- There are many small bugs in the game. There are so many small and weird bugs that are ruining the fun sometimes. I must admit, some bugs are very funny though.

4. RANKING.
- This system is sh*tty. You derank if the killer ragequittes and if you don't perform good enough you will not rank up. If you don't do it good enough/escape you will also derank. You should not lose it, just keep the rank you have.

5. KILLERS CAMPING.
- There needs to be a bigger reason for the killer to not camp someone on a hook. The only reason not to is that if you pick up a survivor more than once on a hook you gain more points. However, most killers don't give a f*ck about it, they just camp until you die and it makes the game somewhat lame.

6. RAGEQUIT NOT TO DERANK.
- As a killer when you are about to kill a survivor, I have noticed this only includes high rank survivors, they ragequit when they are about to die to not derank.

7. REPETITIVE GAME.
- After a while this game gets somewhat repetitive, it needs more gamemodes and more content. I would also love to see some more customization for the survivors and killers, such as more outfits. This would not improve the game overall, I am just a customization nerd.

8. JUKES.
- There need to be some sort of stamina system for survivors vaulting over things. You can so easily evade the killer by just constantly vaulting over the same thing over and over again.

9. ONLY ONE WAY TO DIE.
- It would be nice if they added more than one way to kill survivors. The hook is getting somewhat boring.

10. PLAY WITH FRIENDS.
- You can only play with friends in a private match. "It will come in the next patch" is the only thing that the forums mods can say in defense to any of the bugs and suggestions.

11. KEYS ARE NOT REBINDABLE.
- This might not seem like a big deal to most people, but ALL the left handed people I know prefer to use num pad to play. I feel very sorry for them. Every game should have the option to rebind keys.

Great game! No VoIP so you gotta be aware that you'll be on your own till you find someone else walking... and that might be the killer. So its a good thrill when all of a sudden you're running for your life.

I love this game but I cannot give it a positive review in it's current state.

So many aspects of the game are completely broken.

If the developer can manage to fix it, I will change my review back to positive.

Edit: They have done a ton to fix up this game. There will always be some glaring issues, but it's a good game now. I'm pleased with the effort they have put into it, and have changed my review to positive.
My main game for 2 years now. 10/10!

Amazing experience!

If you want to experience how being Jason or the teens feel in Friday the 13th, then this game is for you!
Both sides are fun to play and offer a different challenge.

As a survivor you can feel the tension as the killer is close to you, your heartbeat start to race up while hoping that he won't spot you in the grass. 
The best way to described this feeling is : you in Outlast or Alien Isolation.

The tricky part is trying to find your teammates and work together.
Will you continue to repair the generator at the expense of your teammate life?
Do you stay if someone blow a fuse?
Do I rush for the exit or I try to help the others so I can net more blood points?
Theses are the questions you will have to answer countless time in the game

As for being the killer, the biggest rush is when you do find a Survivor (it's not that easy) and you start giving chase.
As a killer you will have to chose between 3 style of play.
The Trapper who can be at 2 places at the same time via bear trap.
The Wraith who can become invisible.
And the Chainsaw guy who... Wield a chainsaw.
Expect to rely on sounds and instinct to find your prey.

What's really great about this game is the fact that since every characters in a match is played by a human, the challenge will be different every time.
Will the killer patrol each generator or try to cut pathways.
Will he be a good hunter or bad one?
Will your teammates try to help or play solo?

This game sucks, and here is why:

Balancing an asymmetric horror game is not easy, but this game is a prime example of what not to do to balance a game.
‚Ä¢ Game features are released seemingly without a lot of testing in advance.
‚Ä¢ Game features that turn out to be very powerful during matches are simply removed or massively nerfed.
‚Ä¢ The side that complains more gets more buffs.
‚Ä¢ Several in-game shops clutter the experience.
‚Ä¢ You pay for the game, but you pay a lot of money for repetitive game content additions.
‚Ä¢ The majority of content is licensed from big brands, lacking creativity.
‚Ä¢ The player base is incredibly toxic.

Even if you took a small loan of 1 mil. $ from your dad, you should not buy this game.

The above list of negative points about the game is not complete, but should be enough.
(majority of hours gathered within the first 2 years of release, after that, the game was unplayable because of its changes)

Not really very "horror" but it can be scary when you're running away from the killers and it can and will get VERY intense. Being the killer isn't very intense but it is fun to chase the victims around and sacrifice them.
Fun
Â§ñÊåÇÔºåÊîπÊå°ÔºåÊãîÁ∫øÔºåÂï•Êó∂ÂÄôËÉΩÊîπ„ÄÇ

[h1]POSITIVES[/h1]
Great Game! Really fun and there is a lot to do in the game that makes you want to continue to play. There are unlockables like Perks, Offerings, Clothes, Items, Addons etc. You can level up your characters as well as your rank for both Survivor and Killer.

You can also play private matches with your friends and you won't lose anything if you do die as a survivor.

The ranking system in my opinion is good enough for now; you collect these crystals (at least they look like crystals) called [b]PIPS,[/b] according to the official Dead By Daylight Manual, and when you collect a certain amount in a row,  you get promoted. The lowest rank in the game is 20 and the highest rank is 1. To get from rank 20-19 you must collect 3 pips. From Rank 12 and onwards, you must collect 5 pips each rank down, meaning Rank 12, 11, 10, 9, 8, 7, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2 and 1 require 5 pips each before you get to Rank 1 for both Survivor and Killer.

So the game seems cool, right? Well, most games aren't that perfect...

TLDR: Great Game, Fun, Lost of Unlockables, makes you want to continue playing, Private Matches, Ranking System, Collect Pips to Rank Up, Rank 20 lowest rank, Rank 1 Highest Rank.

[h1]NEGATIVES[/h1]
The only way to rank up in the game is to play public matches, and this makes it difficult because people try and find their friends so they search and quit lobbies until they find them because you currently CANNOT invite your friends to public matches, only private matches, and some players just boost each other. For example one person plays as the killer, hosting the lobby and the other playing as a survivor, and they troll you. There are many disadvantages in the game too, such as:

- The host of every game is the killer. This is bad because almost every killer in the game has a shit ISP.
- Everybody is searching for their friends, and sometimes it can take a while to find a game. The longest it took me to once find a game was 1 hour for this reason...
- You will lag in almost [b]EVERY[/b] game.
- You [b]WILL[/b] rage.
- You [b]WILL[/b] die in stupid ways.
- You [b]WILL[/b] get stuck in objects.
- There are [b]HACKERS[/b] in this game too!
Now it's time to elaborate on these points. The killer being the host of every game really annoys me, just because it gives them a huge advantage. Think of it like this; The host controls everything, and you and your friends are normal people doing normal stuff. But the host has shit internet, and because he controls everything, it affects you and your friends WAY more than it does for him. As a matter of fact, it doesn't affect him at all. [b]LAG[/b] will ruin you, and make you rage. I've lost many games just because of lag. But how does the lag affect you in game? Well, when you attempt to vault over something, like a wall or object, and you're lagging, you are going to die, especially if the killer's chasing you, because what happens is that rather than vaulting, your character [b]FREEZES.[/b] Lag also makes you teleport literally everywhere and will get you killed. This is why you will rage and die in the most stupidest ways.

You will also get stuck in objects. One time I spawned into a game (The developers call these [b]TRIALS[/b]) and I was repairing a generator. Then the killer was coming towards me and I was thinking, "Oh no problem, I will just hide behind this tree." So I go behind 'This tree' and crouch and he walks past me. "Yeh I'm all good." I think to myself. Then I go to walk away from the tree and then just like that, I was stuck. I literally couldn't move, and the murderer was coming back. He walked past me again and didn't see me. Although he didn't see me, I was still very angry, because I wasn't going to be able to survive unless I get him to kill me. So I just quit and also got demoted and lost my item. This is why the Killer has such a [b]HUGE[/b] advantage in the game. This also isn't the only object I've gotten stuck into.

I have recorded games I've played where my connection with the Killer was very bad, and I will perhaps upload them soon to my Steam profile/YouTube channel (Link on Profile!). So be sure to check those out if you would like to see more on what I'm talking about.

Last but not least, hackers, yes, there are hackers already... And the game was only recently released, EVEN with an ANTI-CHEAT! This just really confuses me as to why their anti-cheat software hasn't even banned these players yet. I saw a player who had prestiged his Claudette Morel to level 1000, which at this stage, is an impossible stage to even be on. Most players, almost all, haven't even prestiged, including myself. 

TLDR: Game has more negatives than positives. 

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
So to conclude my review, this game needs more development. The game is great and fun, but when you take the negatives into account, Dead By Daylight isn't really the best game to buy at this time. I believe the developers didn't give enough time on their project and should have continued developing the game and released it at a later date. But the developers are still working on patches and have apparently said they wil be allowing people to invite their friends to public games instead of just private games. So to say they should be adding more patches as well. But in the meantime, I recommend you should save your money for the time being and wait till more patches come through.

Thank you for reading my review!
